meanings.definition: To strike with a sharp blow or slap.
meanings.sent1: She skelps the table to get rid of the dust.
meanings.sent2: He skelps the ball with great force.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat skelps the curtain playfully.
meanings.sent4: The storm skelps the trees, bending them to its will.
meanings.sent5: The teacher skelps the ruler on the desk to get the students' attention.

meanings.definition: A strip or piece of leather or other material used for punishment or reinforcement.
meanings.sent1: The cowboy's belt had intricate skelps on it.
meanings.sent2: She used the skelps to fix the broken strap.
meanings.sent3: The skelps on the bag made it look stylish and unique.
meanings.sent4: The skelps on the collar added a touch of elegance to the outfit.
meanings.sent5: The skelps on the leash were sturdy and reliable.

meanings.sent1: The skelps on his arm left a red mark.
meanings.sent2: She felt the sharp sting of the skelps on her cheek.
meanings.sent3: The playful skelps on his back made him jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The skelps of the wind against the window sounded eerie.
meanings.sent5: The skelps of rain on the roof created a soothing rhythm.
